newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Viag says competitors eyeing Swiss firms.
newsitem.headline: Viag says competitors eyeing Swiss firms.

text.p: European utilities are weighing investing in the Swiss electricity industry because of its key geographical position and abundance of cheap hydropower, Viag AG chief executive Georg Obermeier was quoted as saying.
"The country is attractive for many reasons. Above all it has an important transfer function," he told the Finanz und Wirtschaft newspaper in an interview published on Saturday.
"And Switzerland has a very attractive production structure, primarily because of the high share of cheap hydropower.
"I think the big European companies like German utilities RWE, Badenwerk and EVS (Energieversorgung Schwaben) as well as France's Electricite de France will pursue their interests in Switzerland."

Viag's Bayernwerk AG unit has already said it was in talks with Union Bank of Switzerland on buying part of the bank's 76 percent share in energy holding Motor-Columbus AG, whose main asset is a 56 percent stake in utility Aare-Tessin AG fuer Elektrizitaet (Atel).
It has also expressed interest in the power business of Elektrowatt AG, in which CS Holding has a 44.9 percent stake.
"It would be an illusion to believe that we could buy all of Atel or Elektrowatt," Obermeier said, adding its plans hinged on how the Swiss power market developed.
"We are at the stage of sounding people out and are speaking to all the parties concerned," he said.
